intro: Amomum cerasinum, commonly known as the black cardamom, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the eastern Himalayas. It is characterized by its aromatic, dark brown, pod-like fruits that resemble large, wrinkled pods. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers arranged in panicles, which bloom before the fruiting season. Its leaves are elongated,革质 (leathery), and have a strong, spicy aroma.
